nodes.title: Types of Software Testing
nodes.desc: Overview of different types of software testing.

nodes.title: Functional Testing
nodes.desc: Ensures that the software functions according to requirements.

nodes.title: Unit Testing
nodes.desc: Tests individual components or modules of a software.

nodes.title: Integration Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the combination of different modules or components.

nodes.title: System Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the complete and integrated software system.

nodes.title: Acceptance Testing
nodes.desc: Validates the software against the requirements and checks for acceptance criteria.

nodes.title: Non-Functional Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the non-functional aspects of the software such as performance and usability.

nodes.title: Performance Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the performance of the software under specific conditions.

nodes.title: Load Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the software's ability to handle a specific load.

nodes.title: Stress Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the software's behavior under extreme conditions.

nodes.title: Usability Testing
nodes.desc: Tests how user-friendly and intuitive the software is.

nodes.title: Security Testing
nodes.desc: Tests the software for security vulnerabilities and risks.

nodes.title: Compatibility Testing
nodes.desc: Tests how well the software performs in different environments.

nodes.title: Smoke Testing
nodes.desc: Preliminary testing to check the basic functionality of the software.

nodes.title: Sanity Testing
nodes.desc: Checks specific functionality after changes have been made to the software.

nodes.title: Regression Testing
nodes.desc: Ensures that new changes have not negatively affected existing functionality.

nodes.title: Alpha Testing
nodes.desc: Initial testing performed by internal teams before beta testing.

nodes.title: Beta Testing
nodes.desc: Testing performed by a limited number of end-users before the final release.
